issue.title: Windows with multiple Genomedata archives are erroneously chosen with missing data

content.raw: After some investigation it seems this behavior only occurs in gaps of missing data in a Genomedata archive where the gap is greater than 'MIN_GAP_LEN' (100 000) defined in '_load_seq.py' in Genomedata. When the archive is closed, gaps smaller than that region are merged or otherwise marked as a "chunk" start/end boundary.
content.html: After some investigation it seems this behavior only occurs in gaps of missing data in a Genomedata archive where the gap is greater than 'MIN_GAP_LEN' (100 000) defined in '_load_seq.py' in Genomedata. When the archive is closed, gaps smaller than that region are merged or otherwise marked as a "chunk" start/end boundary.
